abstract: Few obvious candidates exist to replace New York State Assembly Speaker Sheldon Silver, should the arrested lawmaker resign, since insiders say Silver prompted potential rivals to seek other posts; Assemblyman Joseph R Lentol has said he will rise to occasion if asked.
lead_paragraph: Sheldon Silver, who has served as Assembly speaker for more than two decades, has given no indication that he plans to resign. But as Democrats look for a potential heir, they are finding few options.

byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and Michael M. Grynbaum from New York. Susanne Craig contributed reporting from Albany, and Jason Horowitz from Washington.
byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

snippet: Sheldon Silver, who has served as Assembly speaker for more than two decades, has given no indication that he plans to resign. But as Democrats look for a potential heir, they are finding few options.

headline.main: Long Led by Silver, Assembly Democrats Face Uncertainty on a Successor
headline.print_headline: Long Led by Silver, Assembly Democrats Face Uncertainty on a Successor
